meanings.definition: Restricted or confined to a particular area or region.
meanings.sent1: The storm damage was localised to just one neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The localised fire was quickly contained by the firefighters.
meanings.sent3: It was quite amusing to see the localised squirrel gathering nuts only in that tree.
meanings.sent4: Her happiness was like a localised sunshine, brightening only her corner of the world.
meanings.sent5: The localised smell of freshly baked bread made everyone's mouths water.

meanings.definition: To confine or restrict to a particular area or region.
meanings.sent1: The authorities localised the outbreak to a single factory.
meanings.sent2: They localised their search efforts to the nearby forest.
meanings.sent3: The magician localised the disappearing act to just his left hand.
meanings.sent4: She localised her attention on the task at hand, ignoring all distractions.
meanings.sent5: The chef localised the flavors in the dish to create a unique taste experience.
